text: hi everyone today I'm making gel or a
fermented bean curd the Vietnamese way
gel is very popularly used in Vietnamese
vegetarian cooking just like blue cheese
it smells really bad for those who don't
like it but if you can acquire the taste
it's actually really tasty the child
that I can fire at most Asian grocery
store overseas are the Chinese one and
to me they just don't taste and smell as
bold so if you want to recreate the
traditional flavor of Vietnamese
fermented bean curd this video going to
show you how let's begin firstly in a
small saucepan you want to bring 3 cups
of water to a boil together with about a
tablespoon of salt then with half up a
slotted spoon gently drop the piece of
tofu into the water and boil for about
three minutes to sterilize then remove
and place on a piece of kitchen towel
wrap it up and play some heavy slack
objects on top like a large plate or a
cutting board to squeeze out the water
inside the tofu block you can also place
it across a pair of chopstick hanging
over a plate like this and microwave for
about 30 seconds
this half removes the extra moisture in
the tofu making it easier to ferments
has a firmer texture and richer then cut
the tofu block into about 1 inch cubes
[Music]
[Music]
next lie a glass tray with a blush piece
of kitchen towel then place the tofu
cubes into the tray leaving about half
an inch space in between each cube then
cover with another piece of kitchen
towel and then cover everything up with
cling film place it by the window for
about three to five days until it's
starting to ferment you will see the
color of the tofu turning quite of white
and there's a thin yellowish are layer
coating outside edge - you it's
easier to for men in the summer with the
weather getting hot like over 30 degree
sources if you live in in a cold climate
you might want to put it in a warm place
like in the oven and it will take longer
to ferment
now the tofu cubes have become really
soft and dedicate gently use a pair of
chopsticks to lift up and transfer to
glass jar it's very important to use
clean utensils when you're making Chow
so make sure you sterilize the glacier
by putting in boiling water beforehand
and let dry my mom likes to roll the
cubes over some salt pepper to make the
towel mod fragrant and tasty you can do
that too you can also roll them over
some chili powder to make the child look
more colorful later now simply pouring
the brine until is fully cover the tofu
cubes in a jar
[Music]
I'll make the brine by boiling 200ml
water with the gram shot and 50 gram
sugar until is completely dissolved and
then I let it cool down completely
before using then top with 50ml of
cooking wine that's about 1/4 cup
now all what left to do is to leave the
jar as room temperature for about 20
days try not to move the jar or open it
during the time period because that
could affect the fermentation process
traditional Vietnamese cemented bean
curd or gel is very strong and
functioned just like Delian for those
who love it it smells really great but
for those who don't the smell is a
disaster it's definitely an acquired
taste but you know come on
what fermented food doesn't smell bad
when done properly the bingo strip is
soft and creamy and really rich when you
have it a taste
it's pretty salty if you tried raw but
is a really great condiment to make
sauces or add to the Chilean food and
non-vegetarian food alike if you like it
if you give it a try let me know what
you think thank you so much for watching
